titles.title: O blessed Savior, is Thy love

properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: O blessed Savior, is Thy love So great! so full! so free! Fain would we have our thoughts, our hearts, Our lives, engaged with Thee.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: We love Thee for the glorious worth Which in Thyself we see; We love Thee for that shameful cross, Endured so patiently.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: No man of greater love can boast Than for his friend to die; Thou for Thine enemies wast slain! What love with Thine can vie?

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Though in the very form of God, With heav’nly glory crowned, Thou didst a servant’s form assume, Beset with sorrow round.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: Thou wouldst like wretched man be made In everything but sin, That we as like Thee might become As we unlike had been:

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: Like Thee in strength, in meekness, love, In life in ev’ry phase; From glory into glory changed, Till we behold Thy face.

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: O Lord, we treasure in our hearts The mem’ry of Thy love; And ever shall Thy name to us A grateful odor prove.
